intro: Aconitum firmum nothosubsp. fussianum, commonly known as the Fussen aconite, is a hybrid plant native to the Alps. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain meadows and forested areas. It has lance-shaped leaves with a serrated edge and produces showy, spicate inflorescences. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a protected species in many regions.
